result.execSummary:
The defendant Roger W. Holmes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.    **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
------------------------------------

No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No contact with victim or any members of her family.
---------------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
---------------------------------------
Undergo a psychological evaluation or any other evaluation determined necessary by DOC and follow through with any treatment and/or programming recommendations.
---------------------------------------

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence he may be serving

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
-------------------------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No contact wit victim or any members of her family.
-------------------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
-------------------------------------------
Undergo a psychological evaluation or any other evaluation determined necessary by DOC and follow through with any treatment and/or programming recommendations.
-------------------------------------------

Pay restitution in the amount of $602.00 and restitution surcharge.  Restitution is subject to defendant's right to challeng pursuant to local Court Rules.  
-------------------------------------------

IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on December 22, 2021, that:
IT IS ORDERED that the judgment and order of the circuit court are summarily affirmed,
pursuant to WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21.
IT IS ORDERED that the petition for review is denied, without costs.
Petition for Review

IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of the circuit court is summarily affirmed pursuant to
WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.

IT IS ORDERED that unless the Statement of Transcript if filed within five days of the date of this order and a copy of the statement is served on the clerk of the circuit court, the appeal in the above matter will be subject to a penalty under Rule 809.83.
Notification of Filing of Circuit Court Record.

IT IS ORDERED that the time for the appellant to pay the filing fee is extended to October 13, 2020. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.82(2)(a).
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the appellant shall file a statement on transcript no later than October 27, 2020. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.82(2)(a).

2:40 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Roger W. Holmes in court, in custody with attorney Steven C. Harvey.  
Matter is before the Court for a sentencing hearing.  
Court makes record that defendant was found guilty of all counts by a Jury.  
Court did review the PSI and the victim impact statement.  
Atty Harvey has reviewed all of these records with his client.  
Atty Harvey makes record with regard to Mr. Holmes position with regard to information contained in the PSI.  
2:44 pm  Statement by Mr. Tyler Reynolds on behalf of Mr. Holmes.  
2:46 pm  Statement by Atty Herrmann with regard to victim's rights.  
2:47 pm  Court has reviewed both of the victim impact statements.  
2:47 pm  Atty Herrmann has reviewed the PSI.  Atty Andrews plays Exh 1 - audio recording of jail call.  Ct 1 is offered and received.  Atty Harvey objects.  Court makes record.  
2:48 pm  Jail call is played in open court.  
3:03 pm  Argument as to sentence by Atty Herrmann. 
Exhibits 2, 3, 4 & 4 - marked and identified - photos;  Exhibit 6 marked and identified - letter of deft to DA office;  
3:23 pm  Argument as to sentence by Atty Harvey.  3:46 pm  Statement by Mr. Holmes.  
3:56 pm  Court takes 10 minute recess to consider this matter.  
4:04 pm  Court in session.  Same appearances.  Court proceeds with sentencing Mr. Holmes.  
Exhibits 1 thru 6 are offered and received.  

SENTENCE:  
Ct 2:  Total length of sentence is 3 yrs, 6 months prison;  
Consec. to any other sentence he may be serving;  
18 months IC; 2 years ES;  
127 days of sentence credit;  
Not eligible for CIP or SAP;  

CONDITIONS OF ES (Ct. 2):  
1)  No alcohol.  No drugs or drug paraphernalia.  
2)  No weapons.  
3)  No contact with victim or any members of her family.  
4)  Undergo a psychological evaluation or any other evaluation determined necessary by DOC and follow through with any treatment and/or programming recommendations.  
5)  Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  
6)  Pay court costs and DOC supervision fees.  
7)  Pay restitution in the amount of $602.00.  Restitution is subject to the defendant's right to challenge pursuant to local court rules.  
-----------  
Ct. 3:  90 days in WCJ, consecutive to prison sentence on Ct. #2;  
Pay court costs;  
-----------  
Ct. 1:  Sentence withheld, 3 years probation, consecutive to sentences on Cts 2 and 3;  
CONDITIONS of probation shall be the same as the conditions of extended supervision on Ct. #2;  

Court has no objection to transfer of ES or probation to another County or State but it would be up to DOC.  
4:27 pm  Court in recess.

**TRANSCRIPT FILED 11/15/19: COURT REPORTER LINDA MATOSKA**
Order for Representation, Attorney Steven Harvey

Defendant Roger W. Holmes in court, in custody with attorney Michelle Dietrich at the Court's request.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter before the Court as to Defendant's request for certified attorney. Court makes record as to history with the defendant and his demands that cannot be met. Atty Dietrich responds to court's questions regarding her offices contact with the Defendant. Court addresses Defendant as to his position on attorney. Response by Mr. Holmes. Court informs Defendant of her prior ruling and gives other options for attorney. Court asks Defendant if he wants a public defender. SPD to sppoint standby counsel. Court sets matter for sentencing and warns Defendant that if he does not cooperate sentencing will still proceed. Response by Atty Dietrich that per statute they cannot appear as standby counsel. Court will appoint new attorney, Court appointed. 
Minutes filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 18, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

**TRANSCRIPT FILED 10-16-17: COURT REPORTER MARK GARVIN**
Order withdrawing Melissa Frost as counsel for Deft

10:14 am  Court in session.  Case called. Appearances given.  
ADA Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Roger W. Holmes in court, in custody with attorney Melissa Anne Frost.  
Atty Frost needs to make a brief record.  She is in a position that is adversarial to her client and she cannot continue to represent him on this case.  She asks that she be released as his counsel and that a new Attorney be appointed.  
10:15 am  Mr. Holmes objects to her withdrawal as his Attorney.  Court asks why he objects?  Mr. Holmes states he doesn't feel that any new SPD attorney will properly defend him.  He does not believe he has been properly defended.  He doesn't think it would be helpful or even matter.  Response by Atty Frost.  Court will not force Atty Frost to remain as his counsel.  Court asks that Atty Frost prepare an Order.  Court makes record that new counsel will be appointed.  He has the right to an Attorney.  Court asks that Atty Frost reach out to SPD's office, re:  appointment of new counsel.  Court will reset sentencing date once defendant has new counsel appointed.  Court will not reset sentencing at this time but will wait for new counsel to be appointed so that a sentencing date can be reset.  State is making a speedy disposition request on behalf of the victim.  Response by Court that it understands reasons for the speedy request but cannot reset a date until counsel has been appointed.  10:19 am  Court in recess.

**TRANSCRIPT FILED 5/21/18: COURT REPORTER LINDA MATOSKA**

records.addlTxt:
8:23 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Roger W. Holmes in court with Atty Melissa Anne Frost.  
Bailiffs:  Letha Kuecker and George Clettenberg.  
Matter is before the Court to discuss a few issues before bringing Jury in.  
Atty Frost indicates that her client wishes to address the Court in some fashion.  Atty Frost has had numerous conversations with the defendant as to whether or not he will be testifying.  
Court asks the defendant if he is ready at this time to make a decision as to whether or not he wishes to testify.  Defendant has multiply written questions that he proceeds to ask of the Court.  Response by Court.  Court is not going to continue the trial so Mr. Holmes can bring in co-counsel and an ADA certified attorney.  
8:30 am  Atty Frost makes record as to her review of prior transcripts and that Mr. Holmes had previously made these requests but not before this Court.  Atty Frost makes record as to her research with regard to defendant's request for an ADA certified attorney (American with disabilities act).  She could find no information on an ADA certified attorney.  Court is not adjourning this trial or granting the request for an ADA certified attorney and will not appoint co-counsel.  This is not a case that would require 2 attorneys to handle the trial.  Court asks Mr. Holmes it he wishes to make his decision now or at the closing of the State's case as to whether or not he wishes to testify.  Response by defendant.  Court will presume the defendant will not be testifying if he does not indicate whether or not he will be testifying.  
8:36 am  Jury seated in Courtroom.  
8:37 am  Dr. Dilip Patel is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Herrmann.  
8:41 am  No cross. Witness is excused.  
8:42 am  State rests subject to receipt of all exhibits.  All exhibits that were offered have been received.  
8:42 am  Jurors excused from courtroom.  
8:43 am  Court takes recess so Attorney Frost can speak with her client.  
8:50 am  Court in session with Attys and the Mr. Holmes.  Court has colloquy with defendant about his right to testify or not testify.  In response to Court's questions the defendant states he is not able to make any decision at this time without aid of an ADA certified Attorney and co-counsel.  Defendant also states he is "remaining silent".  Court makes further record.  Court asks defendant once again if he choosing to testify. Response by defendant.  Court makes record as to the accommodations that have been made for the defendant because of issues relating to his back.  Court does not believe defendant has been compromised, disadvantaged or discriminated against in any form.  Court does not find any competency issue or NGI issue.  Court's opinion is that he is being obstinate with the Court.  Court gives one last chance for defendant to make a decision with regard to testifying or not testifying.  Defendant asks if he can have a ADA certified attorney.  Court will assume defendant is choosing not to testify by his response.  Atty Frost indicates she has no further evidence to present.  Atty Frost makes record with regard to issue of competency.  It was something that she has considered but she did not believe it rose to the level of requesting a competency evaluation.  Court makes further record.  
8:57 am  Court conducts jury instruction conference with the Attorneys.  Court hears argument of Attys with regard to Jury Instruction 172.  Court will give this Instruction.  Court will not read Instruction 180.  Court will not read Instruction 275.  
9:11 am  Court will take 10 minute break.  
9:23 am  Court in session.  Jury is seated in courtroom.  
9:23 am  Court reads Jury Instructions.  
9:45 am  Closing argument by Atty Herrmann.  
9:55 am  Court takes short recess before defense closing argument.  Jurors excused from courtroom.
9:56 am  No objection to Instructions as read by the Court.  Atty Frost makes record that she believes the prosecutor has violated Hazeltine.  Court makes record and does not believe State violated Hazeltine.  
9:58 am  Court in recess.  
10:06 am  Jurors seated in courtroom.  Closing argument by Atty Frost.  
10:13 am  Rebuttal argument by Attorney Herrmann.  
10:16 am  Court gives final instructions.  
10:18 am  Juror 2949 is released as the alternate juror.  
10:19 am  Clerk swears Bailiffs.  
10:20 am  Jurors excused to begin deliberations.  
10:20 am  Atty Herrmann makes record with regard to his rebuttal argument.  Court is aware of Patino and makes record as to why the Court sustained the objection.  
10:21 am  Court in recess.  
11:12 pm  Court in session with Attys and Defendant.  Jurors have sent a question requesting all of the pictures of the defendant.  
11:12 pm  No objection by the State or the Defense.  Court will send the photos back; Jury Question is marked as Court's Exhibit #1.  
11:13 pm  Court in recess.  
12;52 pm  Court in session.  Court has been informed that the jury has a verdict.  Attys do not have anything to put on the record.  
12:53 pm  Jurors seated in Courtroom.  
12:54 pm  Court reads verdicts.  Defendant found guilty of Counts 1, 2, 3 of the Information.  
12:55 pm  Court polls jurors at request of defense.  
12:56 pm  Court thanks Jurors for their service.  
12:56 pm  Atty Herrmann moves for for judgment on verdicts; Atty Frost moves for a directed verdict in favor of the defense based on argument made at closing.  
12:58 pm  Court enters Judgment of conviction with regard to each of the 3 counts.  Court orders a PSI.  
12:58 pm  Attorney Herrmann moves for defendant's bond to be revoked.  
12:59 pm  Response by Attorney Frost.  
1:00 pm  Court is granting State's request to revoke bond and sets forth reasons on the record.  
1:01 pm  Court in recess.

**TRANSCRIPT FILED 1/3/19: COURT REPORTER SANDY ELDERBROOK**
Voir Dire List
Voir Dire
Juror Selection and Peremptory Challenges
Seating for 13

DA Service fees #581353
$75.00

8:33 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Roger W. Holmes in court with Atty Melissa Anne Frost.  
Bailiffs:  Letha Kuecker and George Clettenberg.  
Matter is on this morning to start a 2-day jury trial.  
Only issue that needs to be resolved is that with regard to prior offenses / convictions of any witnesses.  
Record made by Attys with regard to records of 2 of the witnesses.  
Discussion concerning deft standing during testimony of witnesses.   
Discussion between Court and Attys regarding testimony of victim.  
Court makes record that we are not going to try the nature of their relationship.  
One of State's witnesses is not available until tomorrow morning.  
8:43 am  Court in recess.  

OFF COURT RECORD:  Court takes roll call of Jurors in the Jury Assembly Room. Clerk gives Oath of Competency to Jurors.  Jurors are brought up to Courtroom by Attys.  Clerk seats 23 jurors in jury box.  

9:12 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Charges read by Court.  Court gives preliminary instructions to the Jurors.  
9:14 am  Attorneys introduce themselves, other members of their office and witnesses that may be called.  
9:17 am  Court explains process of voir dire.  
9:19 am  Voir dire by Court.  
9:23 am  Voir dire by Atty Herrmann.  
9:40 am  Voir dire by Atty Frost.  Court voir dires Juror 3392;  
9:58 am  Continued voir dire by Atty Frost.  
10:04 am  Court voir dires Juror 2023.  
10:05 am  Continued voir dire by Atty Frost.  
10:10 am  Attorneys take peremptory strikes.  
10:17 am  Clerks reads names of Jurors who have been struck.  
10:18 am  No objection to the Jury by the Attorneys.  
10:19 am  Clerk gives Oath to Jurors.  
10:19 am  Jurors who were not selected are excused at this time.  
10:20 am  Court takes short break.  
10:26 am  Court reads preliminary jury instructions.  
10:35 am  Jurors excused from courtroom for 15 minute break.  
10:36 am  Discussion with Attorneys, re:  witnesses.  
10:38 am  Court in recess.  

10:56 am  Court in session.  Jury seated in courtroom.  
10:57 am  Opening statement by Atty Herrmann.  
11:07 am  Opening statement by Atty Frost.  

11:10 am  Tracy Meyer is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Herrmann.  
11:15 am  No cross by Atty Frost.  
11:17 am  Kimberly Marmolejo Espinel is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Herrmann.  

Exhibits 1, 2, 3 and 4 are marked, identified, offered, received and published.  
Exhibits 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, and 13 are marked, identified, offered, received and published.  

11:49 am  Jurors excused for lunch and asked to return at 1::00 pm.  
11:50 am  Atty Frost makes record with regard to by victim during her testimony.  Court makes record.  
11:51 am  Court in recess.  

1:00 pm  Court in session with Defendant and Attys present.  
1:00 pm  Atty Frost makes record with regard to questions she would like to ask of witness before Jury comes back in to see if witness recalls her responses to questions asked when she was in the hospital.  
1:01 pm  Response by witness to Atty Frost's questions.  
1:03 pm  Questions of Atty Frost by Court.  Response by Atty Frost.  
1:04 pm  Court has colloquy with witness about responses that she cannot make to questions.  

1:06 pm  Jurors seated in courtroom.  
Exhibits 16, 17, 18, 19, and 20 are marked, identified, offered, received and published.  
1:06 pm  Cross exam of Ms. Marmolejo Espinel by Atty Frost.  
1:17 pm  Objection by Atty Herrmann.  
1:18 pm  Jurors excused from courtroom.  
1:18 pm  Argument by Atty Frost.  
1:19 pm  Court makes record as to what questions can and cannot be asked.  
1:22 pm  Jurors seated in courtroom.  Court explains that State's objection has been sustained.  
1:22 pm  Continued cross exam by Atty Frost.  
1:32 pm  No further questions.  
1:32 pm  Atty Herrmann has redirect but asks to be heard outside presence of jury.  
1:32 pm  Jurors excused from courtroom.  
1:32 pm  Argument by Atty Herrmann.  
1:33 pm  Response by Atty Frost.  
1:35 pm  Response by Atty Herrmann as to questions he wishes to ask.  
1:35 pm  Court makes record and will allow State's redirect.  Atty Frost doesn't object to it.  She objected because she believed it had already been asked.  Atty Frost asks Court for a recess to speak with her client.   1:45 pm  Court in session with Attys and Defendant.  Atty Frost has no record to make at this time.  
1:46 pm  Jury seated in courtroom.  Redirect of Ms. Marmolejo Espinel by Atty Herrmann.  
1:50 pm  No further by Atty Frost cross.  Witness excused.  

1:51 pm  Shelby Maier is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Herrmann.  
1:54 pm Cross exam by Attorney Frost.  
Exhibit 21 is marked, identified, offered and received.  
1:54 pm  Witness excused.  

1:55 pm  Karin Ross is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Herrmann.  
2:00 pm  Cross exam by Atty Frost.  
2:01 pm  No redirect.  Witness excused.  

2:02 pm  Amanda Pipp is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Herrmann.  
2:08 pm  Cross exam by Atty Frost.  
2:11 pm  Redirect by Atty Herrmann.  
2:11 pm  Witness excused.  

2:12 pm  Officer Kimberly Bass is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Herrmann.  
2:27 pm  Atty Frost asks for a couple minute break before starting cross.  Jurors excused from courtroom.  
2:28 pm  Atty Frost expresses concern about a statement made by the Officer during redirect.  Court rules that it is not prejudice but indicates to Atty Herrmann that he needs to be more direct in his questions to the witness.  Court warns Atty Herrmann to be more direct with his witnesses as to what they are and are not allowed to testify about.  
2:30 pm  Atty Frost moves for a mistrial.  
2:31 pm  Court makes record that Officer's comment that she knew about an incident in Florida does not arise to a manifest necessity for the Court to declare a mistrial.  Court indicates there can be a limiting instruction given at the close of the trial.  Court denies motion for mistrial.  Court will take a break to allow Atty Herrmann to speak with his witness.  
2:33 pm  Court in recess.  

2:40 pm  Court in session with Attys and Deft.  Statement by Atty Herrmann as to discussion with his witnesses.  
2:41 pm  Jury seated in Courtroom.  
2:41 pm  Cross exam of Officer Bass by Atty Frost.  
2:43 pm  Redirect by Atty Herrmann.  
2:43 pm  Recross by Atty Frost.  
2:43 pm  Witness excused.  

2:44 pm  Officer Robert P. Rayfield is sworn and testifies on exam of Atty Herrmann.  
2:51 pm  Cross exam by Atty Frost.  Atty Frost indicates she needs to refresh witnesses memory by audio.  
2:53 pm  Jurors excused from courtroom.  
2:53 pm  Court in recess.  

3:03 pm  Court in session with Attys and Deft.  No need to play the recording in the presence of the Jury.  The officer's memory has been refreshed by viewing/hearing the video.  Atty Herrmann agrees that there is no need to play the video.  
3:04 pm  Jurors seated in courtroom.  Continued cross exam of Officer Rayfield by Atty Frost.  
3:06 pm  Redirect by Atty Herrmann.  
3:06 pm  No recross.  Witness excused.  

3:07 pm  Officer Grady Worland is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Herrmann.  
Exhibit 22 is marked, identified, offered, received and published.  
3:32 pm  Cross exam by Atty Frost.  
3:35 pm  No redirect by Atty Herrmann.  
3:35 pm  Response by Officer to Court's questions.  
3:36 pm  Witness excused.  State's only remaining witness is not available until tomorrow morning.  
3:37 pm  Jurors excused and asked to return tomorrow at 8:30 am

3:38 pm  Atty Frost wishes to address an issue.  She is planning on calling Tyler Reynolds in the morning.  He has additional information about the incident that was 2 weeks prior to this incident.  Response by Atty Herrmann.  Atty Frost would just be asking him if he recalled ever seeing any injuries and what the date was on those.  Court will not re-address McMorris motion unless defendant takes the stand.  Anything the defendant said to Mr. Reynolds would be hearsay.  Atty Frost makes record as to what she would ask Mr. Reynolds and it would relate to his observations of the defendant.  Court believes that under Sec. 904.03 any relevance that it might have would be substantially outweighed by unfair prejudice.  Court does not believe it would be proper for Mr. Reynolds to give that type of testimony.  
3:50 pm  Court will conduct jury instruction conference with Attys at this time.  Court makes record that the Affidavit of Tyler Reynolds filed with the case number of  2015GF1135 (a GF file number) and it might not have made it's way to the CF file.  Court will make it part of the court file at this time.  
3:53 pm  Court in recess.

**TRANSCRIPT FILED 5/21/18: COURT REPORTER LINDA MATOSKA**

2:10 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Roger W. Holmes in court with attorney Melissa Anne Frost.  
This is set for trial to set Monday morning.  State was going to be meeting with the victim this morning and defense wanted to know if there were going to any prior acts or incidents that the State would wish to introduce at trial.  Atty Herrmann did meet with her.  Response by Atty Herrmann as to his discussions with the victim and makes record as to statements by the victim with regard to controlling - State wants to show context and nature of their relationship.  2:13 pm  Atty Frost agrees that they are not "technically" other acts and makes argument that she should be able to explore other aspects of their relationship.  Court does not think it is an other act,  Court agrees that it opens the door and allows the defense to explore what the victim testifies to.  Attorney Herrmann makes record with regard to a name change of one of the witnesses due to marriage.  Atty Frost wants a record made that there were no exculpatory statements made when ADA Herrmann had his meeting with the victim this morning.  Atty Herrmann indicates that the Officer met with the victim to review her recorded statement.  Atty Herrmann indicates that to best of his knowledge there is no Brady information that the State has to turn over.  
2:23 pm  Court asks that the parties advise the terms of any offer that was made by the State.  Atty Frost makes record as to the offer and Mr. Holmes is rejecting that offer.  Atty Herrmann that their office had never received anything in terms of a counter-offer from Atty Frost.  Court has colloquy with defendant concerning the offer and he confirms that he is rejecting it.  There are no Miranda Goodchild issues that need to be addressed before testimony.  2:26 pm  Court in recess.

**TRANSCRIPT FILED 5/15/18: COURT REPORTER LINDA MATOSKA**
State

2:30 PM FINAL PRE-TRIAL CALENDAR:  3:56 pm  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Roger W. Holmes in court with attorney Melissa Anne Frost.  
Case is set to start trial on Monday.  It is set for 2 days. 
Court will have 1 alternate and seat 23 in box for voir dire.  
Jury should be ready to be brought up to courtroom at 9:00 am
Court wants Attys and Defendant to be present in court at 8:30 am on Monday.  
Court addresses State's motions in Limine.  
Court will grant exclusion order with regard to all witnesses - Court officer and victim may remain in the courtroom.  
Court makes record with regard to Orders previously made in this matter.  
Court addresses Mr. Holmes about any testimony, re:  character trait of any witness.  
Court is granting 7, 8 and 9 of the Motions in Limine.  
Discussion / argument concerning paragraph 10 of State's Motions in Limine.  Atty Herrmann reads statement of victim into the record.  Court does think that it is an other act but is covered under the greater latitude rule.  Court believes it is admissible under the greater latitude rule and it would also be admissible under a "Sullivan" analysis.  Court does not think it violates Sec. 904.03.  4:22 pm  Atty Frost makes further objection to the State's last minute motions.  Response by Court.  Continued discussion between Court and Attorneys with regard to other incidents.  State will need to instruct witness as to what she can talk about and what she can't.  Court will set this on tomorrow at 2:00 pm tomorrow to address any additional issues that may come up.  
Court addresses remainder of Motions in Limine.  11 - Granted; 12a & b - Granted; 13 - Granted;  
Discussion concerning Defense Motions in Limine.  
Attorney Herrmann would prefer jury not be allowed to ask questions.  
Court would only allow jury questions if both State and Defense agreed.  
Jury Instructions to be prepared and filed by Monday.  
Court wants substantive jury instructions filed by tomorrow.  
Discussion concerning discovery that was just recently provided to the State which involves over 20 hours of recordings.  Response by Atty Frost that the recordings were on her computer and she was not able to burn them to a CD although the SIM card was available to the State.  She does not plan on introducing any of them but if she did, she would let ADA Herrmann know what portion she would be introducing.  Court makes record and denies State's Motion to preclude defense from using them.  Atty Frost makes record that defendant will need frequent breaks and that he cannot sit for long and frequently needs to stand.  Court will make reasonable accommodations for Mr. Holmes.  
Final pre-trial scheduled for March 10, 2017 at 02:00 pm.  
4:45 pm  Court in recess.

3:01 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Defendant Roger W. Holmes in court with attorney Melissa Anne Frost.  
Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Matter is on today for Motions filed by both parties.  
State has filed an Other Acts Evidence Motion.  Atty Frost indicates the defense has no objection to the November of 2013 incident being introduced at trial.  Court has reviewed the Motion and believes the stipulation here is warranted.  It is covered by the greater latitude rule.  Court believes the other acts are similar to the ones charged here.  Court will accept that stipulation.  
Court now addresses the Defense Motions.  Atty Frost has no argument with regard to the Motion for the Psychiatric Evaluation and will rely on the arguments submitted by Attorney Raff.  
3:04 pm  Response by Atty Herrmann.  
3:08 pm  Atty Frost will be filing a Daubert motion.  
3:08 pm  Further argument by Atty Herrmann in response to Motion for psychiatric eval.  
3:09 pm  Response by Atty Frost.  
3:09 pm  Court finds that the Defense hasn't really shown the Court any authority for a psychiatric evaluation of the victim. Court does not believe there is a strong and compelling reason.  Court addresses additional factors in Maday.  Court does not believe the defense has met its burden of proof.  
3:15 pm  Court next addresses the McMorris Motion.  
3:15 pm  Argument by Atty Frost.  
3:20 pm  Argument by Atty Herrmann.  
3:23 pm  Court proceeds with making findings  The first step to determine is "has the issue of self-defense been sufficiently raised?"  Court does not believe State has shown its burden of proof and will not address the other factors under McMorris.  Defense is not going to bring up self-defense in their opening statement.  
Daubert Motion will be filed by Atty Frost by 9/30
State to file response by 10/14

Daubert Motion scheduled for 2 hours on October 21, 2016 at 10:00 a.m.  
Court schedules FPT and JT
FPT on  December 14, 2016 at 2:30 p.m.
JT on December 19 and 20, 2016 at 8:30 a.m.

3:37 p.m.  Court in recess.
